simplify-language.name: Simplify Language
simplify-language.description: Make vocabulary and sentence structure more accessible
simplify-language.purpose: Reduces reading difficulty by using simpler words and shorter sentences while maintaining educational value

example.original: Explain how photosynthesis enables plants to produce their own food.
example.modified: Explain how plants make their own food.

break-down-steps.name: Break Down into Steps
break-down-steps.description: Divide complex tasks into smaller, numbered sub-tasks
break-down-steps.purpose: Reduces cognitive load by breaking multi-part questions into manageable pieces while preserving all required content

example.original: Describe how water evaporates and then forms precipitation as part of the water cycle.
example.modified:
1. Explain what evaporation means.
2. Explain what precipitation means.
3. Describe how evaporation and precipitation are connected.

provide-example.name: Provide Example or Model
provide-example.description: Add a concrete example or model answer to guide understanding
provide-example.purpose: Gives students a reference point by showing what a good response looks like, promoting clarity and confidence

example.modified: Describe how water forms precipitation. Example: When water vapor cools in the atmosphere, it condenses and falls as rain or snow.

clarify-action.name: Clarify What to Do
clarify-action.description: Make it explicitly clear what action or response is expected
clarify-action.purpose: Removes ambiguity by using specific verbs (identify, explain, describe, list) so students understand exactly what is being asked

example.original: In what ways can temperature changes be observed in different states of matter?
example.modified: Describe two ways you can observe temperature changes in solids, liquids, and gases.

remove-ambiguity.name: Remove Vague Language
remove-ambiguity.description: Replace unclear or imprecise wording with specific, concrete language
remove-ambiguity.purpose: Ensures questions are unambiguous by replacing vague terms with specific examples and concrete details

example.original: Discuss how animals respond to environmental changes.
example.modified: Identify two ways animals respond to changes in temperature or light.
